result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------------

No alcohol.   No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. 
----------------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
----------------------------------

AODA assessment and follow through with recommendations.
----------------------------------

IT IS ORDERED, pursuant to Wis. Stats. Sec. 973.015, that upon successful completion of the sentence imposed WITH NO VIOLATION OF THE RULES OF PROBATION, the Clerk of Court shall issue an order expunging the record.

timeConds.notes: to commence on or before 08/01/2016 at 8:00 a.m. and with work release privileges.
